page.title: 03Local History - Belleau
page.content: Mentioned in{Doomsday Book}as 'Engelo' later Hengelowe, Hellowe, Hellewe, Bellew. 13th C. church built by Ralph West of Claythorpe, rebuilt in 1862 using same plan and materials and retaining arcades, aumbry, piscina, rood staircase and loft. Inside the door lies sculptured figure of a knight, crossed legs indicating he had visited{Holy Land.}The Manor, home of the{Willoughby}family from 15th C. was sold in 1650 to{Sir Henry Vane, previously Governor of Massachusetts and{MP}for Hull - Parish Register has entries fo 3 births and 2 deaths of his children. Sir Henry Vane was beheaded on Tower Hill, 1662, memorial tablet erected in Belleau Church in 1915 by English and American admirers. The Manor was demolished and replaced by a smaller dwelling, now demolished. Octagonal turret and other bits remain
